8. Cluster radius estimationÂ¶

Important

This section is outdated.

Todo

Not finished.

We begin by counting the number of RDP points that fall below a given maximum tolerance interval above . When the number of these points reaches a fixed value, , the point closest to is stored as the most probable radius for this iteration. This process is repeated increasing the tolerance around which results in another probable radius being stored, not necessarily the same found in the previous iteration. The final estimation for and its associated error comes from averaging the set of radius values stored this way and taking its standard deviation, respectively.
